ISSUE.TITLE: Independent server and client
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: In #2, @Mec-iS wrote > A HYDRA server that can serve data and metadata to a client (this layer can be split into a traditional lower level server relying on a graph database plus a "HYDRA middleware"), > A client that can "understand" HYDRA metadata and connect to HYDRA-enabled services, and possibly "learn and remember" about past interactions with other services to store its own set of concepts to be used in the usage's domain. I think we *must* insist on developing the client and server as independently as possible. Ideally, different people would work on each part. If we end up with tightly coupled client and server, we will fail to demonstrate the value of Hydra.
